protocol.name: planning
protocol.description: This protocol is activated after a PBI is validated (status = AGREED). Its mission is to transform the functional requirement into an initial technical action plan by decomposing it into atomic, traceable tasks (TASK artefacts).

sub_section.title: mission
sub_section.introduction: The mission of this protocol is to break down a requirement (PBI, correction plan, etc.) into atomic, logical technical tasks (TASK artefacts).
sub_section.note: Decomposition is most often triggered by the PRODUCT OWNER protocol, but can also be required by DEPRECATION, SECURITY AUDIT, or any protocol needing a detailed technical action plan.

sub_section.title: expected_deliverable
sub_section.deliverable: One or more `TASK-[pbi_id]-[task_id]-TODO.xml` files created in `/docs/backlog/01-tasks/`, and a planning report summarizing the plan, listing all created tasks, and highlighting those requiring architectural review.

sub_section.title: task_usage
sub_section.usage: A TASK is an atomic, actionable technical unit derived from a PBI. It must be specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-boxed (SMART). Each TASK is traceable to its parent PBI and is the basis for all development, review, and tracking activities.

details.detail: ID of the parent PBI, ensuring traceability.
Sequential identifier of the task within the PBI scope.
The status of the task in its lifecycle.

list.item: Branch has been merged into main.

content.technical_objective: Clear, unambiguous description of the work to be done, files to modify/create, and expected result.
content.context_and_files: Crucial section for the AI. Contains code snippets, file paths, data structures, and any information needed to accomplish the task.

ai_agent_instructions.description: Sequential and precise list of actions for the agent to execute. Each step should be small and verifiable.

definition_of_done.criterion: The code is implemented according to instructions.
The code follows the project's coding standards.
Unit tests are written and pass successfully.
The code has been reviewed and approved.

content.technical_objective: Create a login form with email and password fields, styled according to the design system.
content.context_and_files:
File: `src/components/LoginForm.tsx`
Use the existing `Input` and `Button` components.
Follow the Figma design: `/designs/login-form.fig`.

ai_agent_instructions.step: Create the LoginForm component with email and password fields.
Style the form according to the design system.

definition_of_done.criterion: Login form renders with email and password fields.
Validation is implemented for required fields.
Form matches the design system styles.

step.title: pbi_appropriation
step.description: Take as input a PBI with status AGREED. Deeply analyze acceptance criteria and constraints. Ask clarification questions to the human_developer if needed.

flight_plan.title: planning_flight_plan
flight_plan.instruction: Before decomposing and creating tasks, the agent must present a detailed plan.
flight_plan.objective: Decompose a PBI into atomic, traceable technical tasks

planned_actions.item: Deep analysis of the parent PBI and its acceptance criteria
Identification of technical components to modify/create
Generation of sequential IDs for each task of the PBI
Assessment of architectural review need for each task

system_commands.item: Check existing task IDs for this PBI

step.title: task_decomposition
step.description: Decompose the PBI into a list of technical tasks according to SMART criteria.

smart_criteria.criterion: The task objective must be clear and unambiguous.
There must be one or more objective criteria (definition of done) to know when the task is complete.
The task must be achievable with available skills and resources.
The task must directly contribute to the parent PBI. No irrelevant work.
The task must be small enough to be a manageable unit of work and not drag on indefinitely.

step.action: For each identified task, create the corresponding `TASK-...-TODO.xml` file.

step.title: triage_and_risk_identification
plan_presentation
step.description: Prepare the planning report listing all created tasks, highlighting those requiring architectural review, and submit it to the human_developer with a clear recommendation.

recommendation_cases.case: If the request is minor, recommend using the FAST-TRACK protocol.
If no task requires review, recommend moving directly to the DEVELOPMENT protocol.
If some tasks require review, recommend activating the ARCHITECTURE protocol.

sub_section.title: commit_content
sub_section.commit_message_template:
feat(planning): Decompose PBI-[ID] into [N] tasks
- Creation of [N] SMART technical tasks - [X] tasks require architectural review - PBI-[ID] updated with the list of associated tasks - Journal updated with the planning process
Tasks created: - TASK-[PBI_ID]-01: [Title] - TASK-[PBI_ID]-02: [Title] - [...]
Next step: [ARCHITECTURE|DEVELOPMENT|FAST-TRACK]

sub_section.title: pre_commit_validation
sub_section.awaiting_validation:
Before the commit, present the complete diff to the human_developer:
Diff of all created TASK files
Diff of the modified parent PBI
Diff of the updated journal
Recommendation for the next step
The human_developer must explicitly approve the complete atomic commit.

sub_section.title: post_planning_modification_management
sub_section.rule: Subsequent modifications to TASKs (status changes, content updates) are part of other protocols and generate their own atomic commits.
